result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:15 AM Defendant Richard J Pierquet appeared by video.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Richard J Pierquet.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim is appearing by telephone. Victim rights legislation has been complied with.  Victim does not make a statement.  Mr Pierquet pleads not guilty on each count. Judicial pre trial at Nov 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:23 PM Defendant Richard J Pierquet appeared by video.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Richard J Pierquet.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. No victim present today. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State intends to file additional class A misdemeanor charge.  Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:45 am.

11:32 AM Defendant Richard J Pierquet in court, in custody.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Richard J Pierquet.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense has received complaint, waive reading.  Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Motion to modify bond by defense.  Court will not hear motion until requested in writing due to victim's rights. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Not to possess weapons, No contact with L.P.(1966) and Z.S.(1997), Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, Not to possess medications without a prescription.

2:06 PM Defendant Richard J Pierquet appeared by video, in custody, without  counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint. DA Hayes speaks to the incident that occurred that resulted in the defendant's arrest. Bond set at $5,000 CASH with conditions: Not to possess weapons, No contact with L.P.(1966) and Z.S.(1997), Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, Not to possess medications without a prescription.  Bond form.
